title: Simplest selling and buying app. However
reviewText: It's hard to get much easier than what Mercari makes it. I sell items to buy items and I love love love their offer system. It doesn't allow for low ball offers. I love that they no have updated to mark when people cancel their transactions. HOWEVER I would love to see them also mark each time a buyer doesn't rate you. I like the rating system, it keeps it honest up to a certain point. However as a seller I'm constantly left with no eaters where I have to wait days on end for Mercari to close it out. I'm too scared to message them and ask them to rate the items since they had received it because I'm sure it would always be the petty person that would give me a terrible rating. But I would certainly chose not to sell to these people that constantly don't rate, it super inconsiderate. But again they've done great with their updates and keeping it easy to sell and buy.

title: The last selling app to go to
reviewText: Okay so I've been using mercari for a long time. #1, their support is awful, one of the worst I've seen. I also wish that you weren't required to have a tracking number because sometimes I sell things that fit in normal envelopes (like stickers) and I have to pay like $4 just to get tracking on it. Also, at the moment, I'm experiencing an issue with a seller. I bought something from them on the 9th and it is currently the 27th. The tracking they provided shows nothing and they are unresponsive to my messages. I keep requesting cancellation but the seller keeps declining it. I've sent multiple emails and messages through support in-app and nothing. If this isn't taken care of, I stg

title: Horrible Experience
reviewText: I used this app to purchase an apple pencil. The seller supposedly packaged and shipped the item. USPS posted that the item was delivered, but I never received it. I put in a claim with the postal company twice and the said they would contact me to inform me about the whereabouts of the package, in which they failed to do. I called them and they suggested I contact Mercari to get help since the seller put no insurance on the item. I opened the Mercari app to access the tracking and seller info from my transaction and all the information was missing and there no proof that I even bought an item using the app. Moral of the story; use Amazon or Ebay as they have a more trust worthy platform.

reviewText: Was doing just fine as a seller on Mercari, until I tried my hand at buying something. The item never came and Merc sent me through hoops claiming that I clearly must not have checked my porch good enough because the tracking said delivered - except I have a P.o. box and it was not delivered. After 3 days of getting the same stupid message over and over, they have me back credits for Mercari. Not a refund. I paid good money for something, never got it & then was given crappy credits to try and make it up. title: Good and NOT so good
reviewText: Pros:-Thankful for another way to sell stuff!!-I LOVE that you can use your earnings to purchase from the app and not be forced to deposit all of your money earned.-the help team does help with issues regarding buyers and sellers in a timely manner-mercari pays for return labels-shipping is CHEAPER! And I've been selling on multiple websites and know the difference-as a seller, I appreciate the "offer limit", not allowing any offer below 20%Cons:-They take 10% RIGHT OFF RHE TOP!-they STRONGLY ENCOURAGE you to ship for free BECAUSE THEY MAKE MORE MONEY OFF OF THE SELLER THAT WAY!-it's easy for buyers to scam sellers by using bogus accounts-the help team seems more 1 sided which helps buyers more-the help team doesn't always communicate with the other help departments and just return items without asking the seller any questions or help mediate-you HAVE TO take returns no matter what-the help team does not give the seller a voice when it comes to returns-it takes way longer to receive funds when depositing, unlike other selling sites-buyers can send returns back empty and you lose out twice, unless you video record opening and shipping packages-most of the time I cannot read messages that I get from buyers...ITS JUST BLANK IN THE MAIL BOX. Please fix this.In a nut shell, there are big pros and big cons. I use multiple selling sites, but lately, This app has been THE MOST PROFITABLE IN A SHORT AMOUNT OF TIME, because of the volume of sales.Try it out but just be cautious.

title: Gouging with fees
reviewText: While the app is fairly easy to navigate, it is horrible in the amount of fees charged. First, there's a flat 10% fee for using their platform to sell your items. Fair enough. But then they only offer their shipping options; I can get my own postage cheaper on most items. For instance, I was selling a magazine I could have shipped via USPS media mail for a few dollars. Mercari wanted $16 for postal service and a bit less with FedEx. Either I would have to fund the $16 or the buyer would, and that cuts into my profit on the item's sale. Then, after being paid, Mercari hangs onto your money to use on their site for purchases, unless you want to cash out, and then they charge $2 to access your own money. So...on a $20 item I was selling, $2 off the top for their fee.  $16 for postage. $2 for cashing out my money = zero for the time and effort in posting items for sale and getting them to either the post office or Fedex. No thank you.

title: Regulations
reviewText: One of the negative things about this site is their rating system.  You have three days to rate and accept an item after receiving it.  Once rated and accepted the sale is final.  If you don't rate them in the time specified, Mercari automatically completes the transaction and there is nothing you can do about it.  I purchased a pair of "Tiffany" sunglasses but was not home to examine the item so I had to accept sight unseen.  Well, the sunglasses were as counterfeit as a three dollar bill and there was nothing I could do about it.  You are not allowed to return the item and you can't even message the seller to make them aware of their deception ( intended or not).  So I was out $60.00 for one pair and &55.00 for another pair.

title: Don't use
reviewText: Tried this app for the first time by selling something small for $15. Once sold it took almost a week after shipping to get my funds. The buyer has to rate you in order for funds to be released. The buyer can recieve it and take a few days to rate you or longer. So after shipping cost and fee my proceeds were $9.25. I was not planning on using this app again so set up a bank transfer and guess what they charge a $2 transfer fee for any transfers under $10. So now my proceed dropped to $7.25. That is some BS right there.  $7.25 wasn't worth my time I put into using this service.  I am deleting the app and I'll never use it again. OfferUp, Facebook market place, and craigslist is much better.

title: Ripped off by seller
reviewText: I made a purchase the  seller didn't even send me the right order she sent me a prohibited item and I asked customer support to return to the seller mercari gave me three days which was the weekend when our post office was already closed Saturday morning and sundays they are also closed and Monday was also a holiday so it was also closed. title: very trustworthy. they handle scammers very well.
reviewText: as a big collector of littlest pet shops, i downloaded this app in search of some cheap *authentic* rare lps. i made many purchases with them and they were all smooth. Until one time this woman posted a picture that she stole from an lps instagram page and claimed it was hers and that she was selling that specific authentic lps for a really cheap price. i bought the lps, she told me it was authentic, i recieved it and was very disappointed to find it was not authentic. (authentic of this lps costs $50-$100, a fake costs about $2 off ebay. i payed $20 for the lps i bought from her, so it was a very good deal.) anyways i messaged the lady very nicely and told her that the lps was fake. she *flipped* out on me saying i was a scammer and i was somehow attempting to scam and take my money back without sending her "precious lps". so i filed a scam report with mercari explaining my situation and, rather quickly, a return was scheduled. the lady still was accusing me of scamming and kept saying that she would expose me rada rada, but after she recieved the lps i recieved all my money back, and everything went well. thanks mercari for carrying out these scammers very smoothly and effectively. i continue to use this app and their scam protection is way better than ebays.

title: Good but could be better
reviewText: For the most part my experience buying & selling on Mercari has been easy and enjoyable. There has been a couple of hiccups with difficult buyers and sellers never shipping items I purchased but in the end after waiting long enough it was sorted out. My main complaint is having to wait 3 full days for payment to be released just because a buyer chooses not to take 3 seconds to fill out a review, I feel Mercari should move to 24 hours after confirmed delivery release of payment UNLESS extra time to inspect the product is requested due to them being out of town or some other reasonable circumstance, 3 days is an unreasonable amount of time and gives scam artist every opportunity to defect the product themselves or make up a story to get a freebie. Otherwise I love the ease of using Mercari!

title: Great App. Fees Are Outrageous
reviewText: Love this app and its ability to connect you to a national marketplace. It also does a great job filtering bots or fake accounts trying to con sellers out of their products.However, the app charges for shipping (naturally), and a seller's fee for the app's services. The shipping is reasonable, but the seller's fee is 10%. I'm not experienced in what normal should be for this sort of market, but the price of 10% seems about twice as high as it should be. Would love to see this reduced. I don't mind continuing to sell my smaller items on here, but taking $100 from a sale of a $1000  item is absurd. For these, I prefer the lesser of the two apps, Letgo. The app itself is worse than Mercari, but they charge 0 fees so I'll put up with it.

title: disappointing customer service
reviewText: I have a Mercari account with over 200 followers and close to 300 5 star reviews from customers. I was recently accused by Mercari of opening this account after having a previous account in which I was supposedly suspended from. I tried to repeal this accusation and closing of my account but they refused to hear out my confusion and look into the mistake. Mercari is very finicky with what words to use when posting goods and it's practically impossible to contact customer service and actually have a conversation with an agent. They clearly don't take into account your reviews and business you have brought them and don't hear out your case when accusing you and choosing to ban you. I loved Mercari when using it but beyond frustrated with their customer service and inability to flag other sellers or buyers for harassment unless you just flag a single message. It's disappointing when they don't look into each case or into a loyal seller and buyer before banning them.

reviewText: Worst Customer Service.I have been using Mercari for over three years. In one occasion, I was scammed by a seller that never shipped my item and provided me a tracking number that never existed. So, now I decided to start selling some of my stuff and I always have been kind and honest to all my buyers since I know because of them how to be scammed feel like. But, the first time that I listed a purse Mercari inactivated it because they say that the item was not authentic without requesting any proof of authenticity. I thought that it happened because that was my first list and they did not have any reviews of my selling. Since they have many people who sell faux stuff as they describe it openly. Sunday I tried to list the item again and they decided to delete my account. I think that is so unfair because they don't even check my reviews as an excellent seller and they have many other sellers that really scam people and they don't take care of that.

title: Awesome!
reviewText: Mercari is an amazing app. I've been using eBay for years now and recently converted ALL of my business over to Mercari. Mercari has AMAZING customer and seller support. Anytime I've ever experienced an issue, it has quickly been resolved. However, the reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because of lack of communication options in the app. Someone went through and liked all of my WWII DVDs, and I wanted to offer them a deal if they bundled all of them, but there is no way to message someone unless you do it through one of their listed items — which I feel may be rude; and it doesn't work if they don't have any listings. Other than that, I love Mercari. Will definitely change to 5 stars once an enhanced messaging system is added.

title: Love Mercari, Hate the Shipping Changes
reviewText: Mercari has made selling so easy. It has "almost" replaced all other selling platforms for me. However, since I began using Mercari to sell, it only cost about $3.50 to ship an item under 16oz. Since, they have had multiple shipping hikes. As I write this, I believe it is now up to $5.75 for 16oz and of course, higher with all weight classes. I don't know if the price increase comes from Mercari or the Mail carriers, but it's almost not worth posting certain items.  Also, they suggest selling with "free ship" to the buyer, as it has a higher chance of selling. However, if you choose this option, you will pay them 10% of the total sale including shipping costs. But if you charge the buyer for shipping you are only paying Mercari 10% of the sale price. Basically, you pay them more if you choose the free ship option. Overall, I will continue to use Mercari for the ease of use and simple interface. However, if the shipping rates continue to increase, it will be harder to sell in my opinion.

title: Good app with some obnoxious features
reviewText: A pretty solid all-encompassing sales platform that's a lot easier and less intimidating than ebay. In-app shipping labels are great, and the 10% commission is pretty standard for sales apps. That being said the app itself is really, really obnoxious. It sends constant pointless push notifications just to remind you it exists which there is no way to disable without turning off notifications for the entire app. It also automatically likes items if you interact with them in any manner beyond looking, ie. if you accidentally click "message seller", and automatically follows searches if you seem interested enough in them(which, fyi, will result in you getting... more push notifications!)

title: Scam! Sellers beware
reviewText: Update 10/1Still can't get to anyone via the phone. The in-app help people keep directing me to their billing department with a number that noone ever pick up.Good thing is though i cant log on to the app, i manage somehow log in to the website and request my money back.I have to pay out of pocket to return the item seller shipped to me after mercari cancel transaction. Not much but did just show how irresponsible it was, and how riskyy it is for the seller if buyer's acct got closed after he ship.Update 9/28They contact me back now saying I was closed because i have been reloved from the marketplace before.What are they talking about? How did i got removed from marketplace before? That account is the 1st one i ever had on Mercari. There's no way I can create an account and forget about it since Apple appstore show I first download Mercari app 06/24/2019, which also match my date of joining Mercari on this phone.This is my appstore acct since the 3gs. For godsake, my husband was the one invite me for the $10 discount they're giving and his account also got closed at the same time as mine for the same reason.  Who's in the right mind would come back for to build their seller reputation on such an unreliable marketplaces. Ebay, Amazon, even Offerup has better customer services. Never i've been treated like trash and felt insult like this.I dont care to join Mercari ever again. It's biased, unfair and clearly scam practices.Just give me back my current balance($8.10), pending payment ($35 shipped package ) and  the anticipated return shipping fee for the item i bought & you guy cancel after the seller shipped it. ——————-I lost $43 (my current balance and the pending amount for item i already sent). the guy who sell me his items lost $68 too cause they cancelled all my purchases after he shipped. Luckily for him that i will return it once it'll arrive, but atm can't even let him know Cause i Can't even log in to the app. Both my husband and i've been using this app to buy and sell old inventories in good faith. We're verified email/phone.. and have good rating after transactions all the way.Mercari just closed both our accounts 5 minutes apart for the same reason of "Multiple accounts per user" which is a completely false accusation. We both never have any different account other than the ones we're using and being closed. I tried to contact Mercari through their help page, email, phone call,  fb msg... and noone care to answer or simply just passing me around to billing department(which never contact me back). 24hrs customer service?! That's a joke, try it you'll see.Extremely poor service and policy. I'd rate 0 star if i could.Totally Scam app! You're at risk for selling anything here cause they can close your acct and keep your money without any valid reason., just falsely accuse people and ignoring them totally.

title: Ppl that run this App are crazy
reviewText: Yes the selling your stuff and making money is great. That part is as good as any selling app. They do have a low seller fee so you can save a couple dollars ( just a couple). But I've used this app for a year now on and off and now I'm done with it. First it kept asking me to verify my identity and they want you to do that by providing your SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER! Then when you ask why they said it's the law and anyone using their app has too...it's in their privacy agreement. If you don't do it they will cancel your account with no problem. They love canceling and deleting your account over any discrepancy. They will also delete your acct if they see or even think (without any facts) that you have a replica or fake designer item to sell. They deleted my friends page talking about here item was fake and it was 100% legit. And they don't even investigate either. So it's a thumbs down for Merc...they can't have my social security number! They are asking for too much as if they are the best when they aren't. I REPORTED THEM TO THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU. And so should any user that's forced to provide that type of sacred personal info!

title: Many improvements needed
reviewText: I want to love Mercari— especially as a seller, because of the lower fee they take on every sale— but I use Poshmark way more.  The fact that I have to change my size & availability any time I search for something new is ridiculous.  The system should automatically remember what size I wear.  And I'm not sure why I see any of the items that are already sold.  With every new search, I have to change the availability preference, when it should already default to "for sale."  As a buyer, I'm not concerned with an item in my search that's already sold.  What good does that do me when I'm looking to buy said item?  It doesn't make any sense.  I feel like those are the two biggest hindrances in this app that could be definitely improved upon.  Aside from that, I enjoy Mercari as both a seller & a consumer.  The rates are reasonable, I enjoy the ease of the app, and I'm pleased with the layout.

title: No Seller protection
reviewText: I sold a Louis Vuitton speedy in fair condition for a fair price. The buyer changed her mind about the bag. All sale are supposed to be final , unless the item was different than described. Well the buyer decided to slash 3 of the 4 corners of my bag , in an attempt to get a refund ,,based on the slashes not being disclosed in the description. They were not disclosed because they did not exist. Mecari immediately approved the refund and issued the refund before I was able to dispute it. Even tho I immediately disputed it once the bag arrived back to me and I saw what she had done.  I have been back and fourth with customer service via chat on the app. Which is not live. So I wait and wait and wait for a reply each time I pled my case. Long story short,, there is no protection for you as a seller. This person could have sent me back a bag of jelly beans ,,, but as soon as the item is marked delivered,,,, case closed.  The criminals and scammers that may be using this app also get your name and address from the shipping when you sell or buy something. Which in my case is not so bad because I plan to take this person to court. That's if it's even a real name. Mercari has been no help at all. I've been sent messages apologizing that the transaction did not go as I would have like.... uh no it didn't. No compensation for the damage to my bag. If you sell anything at all... don't let it be anything of value. If you buy something, you're still taking a gamble.

title: I used to love it, now I definitely not!
reviewText: I used to loved this app. All of my reviews were great! I was a reputable seller and buyer... but two times one person tried to buy a luxury purse from me. She sent an offer for $250 which was insane because the purse was literally new! The listed item was $750. I obviously denied her offer. Then "someone" decided to reported my item as counterfeit, right away after I denied. I take off the purse from my listing and decided to uploaded it again with more clearly photos and proof of purchase. I did sold my purse and received a great review from that buyer. In other occasion, I listed another item (bundle of 2 purses because the buyer wanted a better price on the shipping) since the beginning I uploaded every clearly photo, proof of purchase, authenticity and everything... well, the buyer decided to canceled the order because she was having problems with her bank. She told me she would get back to me as soon as she resolved the problem with her card. Mysteriously the fist buyer I stated above, offer me again $300 for the 2 items. I don't have to tell y'all that OBVIOUSLY I denied again! And my items were reported as counterfeit once again.  Ok lets get to the point... who would offer $300 plus shipping for counterfeits???? When there are other selling apps that offer them for $40 or so... or who would rate "counterfeit items" as great for $75O when a brand new "genuine purse" is almost the same price? Mercari decide to banned me for "selling counterfeit items" without notification. They just sent a msg telling me to upload a clearly photos... like what in the world they wanted???? What's else!!!! I was uploading everything I had that proofed their authenticity!!! That night I tried to open again my account to buy something... and my account was "suspended" I tried to contact someone but their customer service is beyond TERRIBLE! They said they were investigating... so I decided to leave that account. I made a new one, and I was buying again and selling pink clothes, shoes, Victoria's Secret stuff... so I got around 10 or so great stars and when I tried to buy a wig a msg popped up in my inbox and they said my account was suspended again and that they had to hold all of my money while the investigation. The "investigation" was another dramaaaaa! It was a headache to recover the money I made for my sellings. They literally lied to me! They told me that I had to sent photos and proof of myself for verification. After that I sent everything they were RUDE!!! They told me I was banned since the first time. The first time that I wasn't aware why my account was "suspended" they ask you for photos for future accounts so that way they have information about you in their records. After that the banned you and they said that their decision is final. So??? I was banned because other people decided to. Now you know that you can flag whoever you want even when they're selling a piece of rock and Mercari won't make an actual investigation. They would just let the algorithm do its job and then the customer service will sent a suspended msg without a further investigation. Even if they apologize for this sh** I will never recommend or download again this app!!!!

title: Irresponsible Sellers Face No Consequences
reviewText: This is the "Wild West" of online shopping platforms. Buyers cancel transactions at will ( within 3 days of  the sale date) and face no repercussions. You can't even rate them.   Also, to make matters worse, although your purchase proceeds are processed swiftly, upon cancellation you will be informed that the refund may take 5-10 business days. Too many inexperienced sellers treat this platform like an online garage sale. Just not worth the frustration for serious buyers.

title: Customer Service?
reviewText: I'll start off with saying, I buy and sell a decent amount off Mercari due to its ease of access. Shipping is easy, buying and selling are easy. If you have no issues, then it's perfect. However. At some point you'll have issues. Someone will want to return something or you get an item that is not as described. This process is terrible. It is not a two way process. If you wish to return an item, you send them a request with photos. Then they evaluate the evidence and they decide. That's it. There's no consulting the second party. No defend your case if you will. Everything they do essentially becomes locked in. This also applies to reviews. You can't see the other persons review, until you leave a review. However, when you do this, you can't reply if they leave a negative review. Essentially this is not a two party app. It's a one party that supports certain people in certain situations. I still buy and sell, but I become more reluctant to do this because of the weak customer service. I'll likely be returning to eBay for my selling.

title: Best Selling App
reviewText: It is so easy to use.  Take a picture of the item, describe what you are selling, estimate the shipping weight, either you pay for shipping or buyer pays shipping, set your price and list.  It is quick and simple.  I like that once the item is sold, you are emailed the shipping label.  So you print it, pack your item, attach the label and take it to the shipper (Fedex, USPS).  I just started selling less than 2 weeks ago and have already sold 25 items.  I also like that I can either use the money in my account to buy items or just get the money.  This is a great way to sell things.

title: Terrible Business Practice
reviewText: I used Mercari a few times and appreciated the deals I found. But after one transaction I received a notice from them that they were closing my account. After trying to talk to them about it over email followed by sitting on the phone for 30 minutes waiting to talk to a live person, they ended up sending me an email saying I had been found to have multiple accounts with them, which is a lie. I had only one account. Without evidence or anything to show me why they came to that decision they closed my account. No questions asked. I am offended because they question my integrity. I can say that I would not recommend this app or company to work with after how they treated me.

title: People are gonna download this anyway, but this must be said
reviewText: I've been selling on this app since April and I did not have a problem until today. This is by far the WORST selling app I have sold on from my 5 years of selling. Mercari closed my account over a misunderstanding. Even when I explained myself. They don't let you create another account whatsoever. You can online, but once you log in on the app, they close the new account. I even tried to log in on my gf's account and they closed hers just because I signed in. She didn't even do anything wrong! And neither did I!The fees are ridiculous too. If you sell anything above $30, you're making way less. Honestly, they should just charge a monthly fee like EBay whenever you sell, but this is just pathetic. A fee for each sale? Crazy. The other day they gave me a $10 coupon, but it was only if I bought something $50+. What's so great about it? Their rules are pathetic. This whole app is pathetic. Even if I could resell on this app, I wouldn't. I only used it because it was quick and easy, but Mercari is just on a whole other level of strict. You say one (1) thing in dms with a buyer and Mercari shuts the whole convo down.

title: Was good, now it’s a pickup spot for creeps
reviewText: Used to love this app, especially when it didn't have a selling fee and the shipping was reasonable. Now 9/10 times I ship on my own because it's cheaper for the buyer than the $9.90 shipping you're charging. Also, used to be a decent place to resell clothes. Now every single day I'm getting messages from men asking for my phone number, USED panties, commenting rude things about my body (again...no pictures are sexual). I've reported these men multiple times and nothing happens. But I finally snap and send a response and IM the one that's flagged?? Get it together mercari. You can see that I used the word "Venmo" (context: if you're going to make me read your stupid messages you could at least Venmo me for my time) and deleted my comment and gave me a warning in less than 15 seconds, but can't do anything about creeps asking for my PHONE NUMBER?? Or my Instagram name? Or my used undergarments? After I've already reported them? Seriously? Going to stick to Facebook marketplace after this...

title: Great app!!!!
reviewText: I have been using this app for over a year now and I absolutely love it!!!!! I have been buying stuff from different sellers and For the most part everything is going great. title: THIS APP IS A SCAM
reviewText: Don't waste your time and money with Mercari. I have "sold" one item on the platform, which consisted of me shipping the item the day it was purchased, the buyer saying they hadn't received it in 3 days while it was still in transit, and Mercari telling me they can do nothing about it. I have lost $60 now because I won't be getting my game back, I won't be paid by Mercari, and I won't even be reimbursed for the money I paid to ship it! What a complete scam of a "business", I know others who have had a similar experience with Mercari, and I see a class action lawsuit on the very near horizon for this dumpster fire of an app!

title: Great way to find bargains
reviewText: I've been using this app for over 2 years now and I've seen how many changes (positive) it's made to the app, which add to the experience. I just wanted to leave this review to add a suggestion that I and many other people have.. on the offer option, there needs to be a way to edit and offer when someone else offers more than your initial one. So for example if I send someone an offer for $100 and someone else sends one for $110, I will lose out on the item because someone offered $10 more. There should be a way to edit my offer, or at least an option to be able to offer more, before the seller accepts. This would be in everyone's interest, the seller the buyer and Mercari's. It's my only frustration with the app, not being able to edit the offers.

title: Never Received any type of Refund! Even though the item I purchased did not meet the description!
reviewText: Do NOT ever send the seller anything back even if the item does not meet the description! I sent the seller back a coach purse and mercari sent me the wrong label for the seller so needless to say it was sent to another location. Even though I took the package to the usps and it was sent out it was still my problem according to mercari. So I in the end with the purse being sent back to me due to it being sent to the wrong address I never received my money back and was stuck with the purse that did not meet the description. Mercari told me I only had 3 days to send it to the seller however with it going to the wrong location they washed their hands of it. I sent over 20 emails and to this day I still have that purse and I did NOT receive any money of mine back for a refund! I personally feel this company truly lacks any type of professional customer standards. I will not continue to use mercari to purchase and possibly sell my items. I will admit this app is easier to use than the other competitor company  though. But with them never giving me a refund for something that was not even my fault I would be very cautious on using mercari if you do.

title: Hard to use and spammy
reviewText: After seeing commercials, I decided to download and try to sell a pair of headphones. The app is a bit confusing to use, but I managed to set up an account and post a pair of headphones to sell. Immediately a buyer bought them, and then cancelled the order, forcing me to repost. Then buyer number two "made me an offer" which was 30% less than the price I posted, but I took it, because I wanted to try the app. The buyer then reached out to me because they had the incorrect shipping address on their account- and asked me to cancel and repost, which I was unable to do because the app won't let you. So I had to ask the buyer to cancel several times which was really frustrating. Third time is the charm, I reposted after fighting the app, which for some reason, tried to make me repost at a different amount. When I finally made the sale the buyer kept asking me weird things like if the headphones were real, or if I had more, or what the serial number was. The app gave me a "warning" and removed any serial number I tried to share. I guess it thought I was sharing a phone number, but Instead it was blocking me from answering a real buyer question. I mailed the headphones, and it cost twice what the app predicted- which was more money out of my pocket. And then I had to wait three days after the package was delivered for Mercari to release the payment, because the buyer had failed to rate me. In addition to this I now get spammed by in app notifications and emails several times a day. I just deleted the app and don't recommend it to anyone. It's not worth it.

title: Pros and Cons
reviewText: I like that Mercari only gives the seller 3 days to ship, unlike other sites that allow an unresponsive seller 7 days before the buyer can cancel. I don't like that a buyer can only offer a certain % lower than asking or that a seller can set their shipping at $18 for a top if they want to... that is absurd. I also don't like that people who smoke don't mention they do and their items wreak of cigarettes and that smell is really hard to wash out. People who don't smoke usually say smoke free but do I have to ask EVERY TIME? Nothing is being done to correct this issue.

title: Risky
reviewText: I've sold items on the app and there's no safety net for sellers. This app allows a seller to purchase shipping labels on their own dime, and if for any reason a buyer wants to return your item, it's approved. They claim they have a final sale policy but they don't. So whenever a buyer wants to return your item, they get to return it and you're out the money you spent to ship it. Poshmark has much better security for both buyers AND sellers. I'm no longer using this app and solely using Poshmark.

title: Easy to sell. Not so easy to get paid!
reviewText: This is a very simple App to use for selling or buying BUT as a seller, out of all the apps out there,it's the most difficult to get paid. Between the fee and free shipping, most listings in clothing come in under $10. But you won't get paid until you reach $10 after shipping & fees unless you're willing to pay $2! When you're selling used women's clothing that's a big cut...you're better off with Poshmark or eBay...at the least they pay out with no minimum surcharge!

title: Mercari is great when it comes to buying, but it’s selling options are sorta mixed.
reviewText: The aspect of Mercari's buying system is perfect. You can get some fast deliveries within a couple of days depending on who you are buying from. It's really hard to get scammed on this app, so you will 90% get the item you want. Refunds are allowed at all times which is great. You can actually set up offers. Everything on the buying aspect is perfect.However selling off items is sorta frustrating. Usually with these apps like Depop and Grailed, you get the money as soon as you sell an item. That's a different story with Mercari. You don't get the money until the sold item is delivered. I dislike waiting for almost an entire week just to get a measly twenty dollars. I want the money as soon as I put it in shipping. Having to wait awhile for this to happen makes it hard for sellers to enjoy the app, because truly it is an amazing app. Why not make it perfect by allowing sellers to get the money up front? If people are worried about scammers, they can look at a users account and get a good look to see if they are trustworthy. A lot of the people on here are very friendly and deserve to get their money up front. In conclusion, it has a small flaw, and like people like me, we deserve our money for selling off our prized possessions. 4/5

title: Terrible Buying Experience
reviewText: I'll start off saying I usually don't write reviews of apps or bad reviews in general but this takes the cake. I waited longer than the given three day window for sellers and even contacted a seller about when the item would be shipped only to ignored. I did reach out to customer service for help but they can only try to contact the seller and or cancel the sale. So not much help. reviewText: I received an item that was not as advertised and called the customer service department at Mercari to see what could be done about it. title: So disappointed
reviewText: I have been using Mercari for over a year now and have sold over hundreds of dollars worth of items. Then they send me the $8 in their money not a refund?? I'm so upset about this. I have made them so much money and they screw me over. It's bad business to screw over your customers for EIGHT DOLLARS. They also lied to me. I wouldn't have paid shipping and they reviewed the person with 5 stars automatically when they didn't deserve it. title: Not a good experience
reviewText: I downloaded the app about 4 months ago I bought a jacket that once delivered it came a size smaller than the info said. But I got refunded when I told them what happened but I only got credits I didn't get my actual money back which was annoying but oh well. So I bought a shirt a few weeks later and it's supposed to send within 3 days of you ordering it but I waited a week and I messaged the seller and then they cancelled my transaction. So then I ordered another shirt just a couple weeks ago and when it came it was the same color as the picture but the proportions of the shirt was way off and it was a women's large and it fits my skinny 13 year sister perfectly and she wears an extra small!!!! I'm not a fan I gave them 3 chances and none of it worked out. My friend also ordered a shirt and she's in high school and when it came note it wasn't supposed to be a crop too or anything but this shirt she ordered fits her 10 year old sister perfectly and it was a women's medium. It's actually ridiculous!!!

title: Unauthorized User??
reviewText: I've been using this store since last year, until this morning. I have items posted, have requests for more photos, other notifications. As I was going to reduce the price of my most recent posting- I got the message on my screen, Unauthorized User Sign up now. title: Canceled Order after it was sent & holding money
reviewText: Mercari canceled an order I sold and blocked me from messaging the seller AFTER I already shipped the item. There is an option to contact them if this happens but you have to pick the order, and they deleted the order, so it's not even an option to pick. The product was ALREADY shipped and there is no way to retrieve it so I'm out the product, the money I spent to buy the product and shipping money. Contacted Mercari with the issue and of course, no response. RIDICULOUS. Also they're still holding almost $300 for products I sold, shipped with their labels etc. I will be taking my money out as soon as I can, contacting the Better Business Bureau and NEVER using this app again.

title: Theyre a good alternative
reviewText: I have quite a few good things to say about Mercari:1. They aim to be as comprehensive as possible while maintaining a user-friendly interface. Much of it is intuitive but they can definitely improve2. The insurance is $200 for anything that uses their prepaid label. That's good since it covers a lot of items.3. I like the fact that buyers are required to rate the seller in 3 days. This discourages scammers. Although the down side is that funds don't get released quickly, but sellers should adjust to this since it benefits them in the long run. What I dislike:1. They removed the bulk pricing for shipping (0-0.5 lbs, 0.5-1, 1-3,3-10 etc). That used to be the most cost effective method for bulkier items but now we have to pay more if we're offering free shipping. 2. I hate that we can't see the rating that buyers give us before we can rate them. I think this skews ratings to become more favorable for buyers than sellers.

title: Fantastic way to buy and sell!
reviewText: I've used Mercari for about 5 years mostly as a buyer. I've never had a problem or disappointing situation. This is a great way to liquidate surplus personal items or even function as a third party  seller. Prices are reasonable and you can always contact the seller with questions if needed. I like being able to save product searches. You can use the same search at a later time and Mercari automatically updates with newest available products. Shipping is reliable and prompt. All in all, this is a great way to shop at your convenience.

title: LOVE...but there’s one HUGE takeaway
reviewText: Ok so this has been such a staple in helping to make money while clearing out the excess amount of beauty products I have. It's soooo much better than any other selling app, you get to keep way more of your earnings!! Apps like poshmark really rob you with the sellers fees, and as a buyer it automatically robs you with the absurd shipping fee of $6.49 no matter how small the item you bought was. Mercari is much more flexible with that option. I choose to pay for shipping out of my own pocket because I know that's gonna get me the best price and make it more likely to get more sales ;) So here's the one problem (hence the one star I had to take away)...there's not enough protection for us sellers. You have people who have "recently become a member" with no ratings, no profile pic, and no bio, who will purchase from you. These people are completely unresponsive. They will absolutely ignore your messages and rating requests from both you and mercari. So even though you've let's say, gone down on the price and shipped the item quickly to ensure quality customer service and a positive rating...they make you wait the full 3 days only to have your funds released automatically, thus robbing you of the ability to warn other sellers that this buyer doesn't rate on time. And so the cycle continues. Or even worse (in my case) if usps somehow miraculously doesn't log the tracking on your item, this person will get away with stealing your item AND getting their full refund. And no matter how many calls to usps you make, no matter how much you've kept in touch with mercari, they don't do anything about it. The seller was actually SO UNRESPONSIVE that they never even answered mercari. The seller also didn't even try to contact mercari and let them know that their item wasn't received after THREE MONTHS from it's purchased date! If I bought someone and didn't receive it, I'd request a refund after 2 weeks of waiting. She didn't contact them at all. So I know she got my item. And she got my money. If you want to improve the app, Mercari, then you need to find a way to protect us sellers from people with no integrity!!!

title: Review
reviewText: So many things to say but I'll keep It short. You shut down my account and gave me no reason after I tried to make a purchase. This restricted me from explaining to the seller what had happened (while I still didn't know). During this you sent me a message telling me that I should receive another message that says that would make me go through a verification process (mind you, this is after I attempted to call the customer service number which didn't work because the office hours are 9am to 5pm. So then I had to wait until the morning to call again). I still didn't receive this notification in my inbox and I emailed a response to customer service to let them know as well. Still no response. I called in the morning at 9am and continued to call until 10:30 and still no one was available. I got a notification at 1pm that told me that something was wrong with my transaction (which was pretty obvious by then) I continued to call as the seller I was trying to buy from was asking me why I backed out and I couldn't respond to her because of the restrictions. After a wait period of 18 minutes I finally was able to talk to a representative who told me there was nothing he could do and didn't give me any information about my account after I gave him my account details. By then the item I was trying to purchase was sold to another person. My account was still restricted and I called customer service again and the same thing happened: no information about my transaction. By then I had gave up. Then finally I got a message that asked me to verify myself and I did. The process to get verified took another day and still didn't work. My account finally got sorted out after that and then my seller had already shipped the product. Does this sound like good customer service.

title: I love Mercari, but...
reviewText: This app has improved so much since I started using it in February 2018! It has become my favorite online marketplace and is currently the only one I use for selling. Pricing items is very straight forward (unlike Ebay) the seller's fee is reasonable (unlike Poshmark) and there's tons of traffic (unlike Vinted). I've made over 1200 sales and most buyers have been pleasant, reasonable people. I've bought a few things on Mercari, too. I am happy with all the items I received and have encountered very few unreliable,unfriendly sellers. I'd love to give Mercari 5 stars, but there are a few changes that still need to be made: Please allow sellers to disable the "make an offer" feature for items priced under $10 that include free shipping. Buyers expect to get items at a lower price simply because the offer button is there. For those of us who sell only low priced items, this is a problem. As it is, we get very little money after the shipping label and the fee.  We get $2.41 for a $6 item, but we only get $1.51 if we accept the $5 offer that we almost always get. That extra $1 makes a huge difference for the seller. Also, a bundling system would make things so much better. Many buyers want to bundle items, but this is challenging and frustrating for both seller and buyer. The buyer has to wait for the seller to see and respond to their message and create their new bundled listing. Sometimes an item they want to add to their bundle gets purchased by another buyer. Once the seller gets a change to read the message, she has to edit photos, weigh the combined items, create a new listing, delete the original listings... sometimes the seller is unable to do this immediately and loses the sale because she's driving, is at work or is asleep while her buyer is shopping. Lastly, the "Restricted Items" list needs improvement. Most areas of the restricted list is very straightforward (no weapons, drugs, food, ect) but other areas of the list are vague. For example, most over-the-counter skincare products are allowed, but some over-the-counter skincare products will get a seller into trouble. I almost lost my account 6 months ago because of a Neutrogena Retinol serum I listed. Prior to listing the serum, I had done a search in the Mercari app and saw dozens of live listings for the exact item, many had been live for months. I was luckily able to contact an understanding Mercari employee and keep my account from being permanently closed, but it was still a stressful, horrible experience for me. Please add restricted skincare ingredients to the list so cosmetics sellers know for sure which products can't be sold on the app.

title: 9/9/19 “Update”
reviewText: This "update" feels like a downgrade. More button presses to achieve the same thing. My for listings and sales, all current and in progress and completed are relegated behind a profile button now. Notifications and messages did not need to be split at all, and filters for messages are beyond useless, the tab structure was so much easier to use. If you insist on moving the profile to the top left then display that button on the notifications and messages screens so I don't have to go to the home page on the bottom left to then go to the profile in the top left. ... Also I have over 150 completed sales and every time I choose to ship on my own I get a warning like it's my first time, I understand I have to put the tracking number in, stop showing this warning. Another thing, you don't need to re prompt about promoting or other tutorials, I haven't forgotten how to use the app in a matter of two days. I've used all ten of mine for the day and I'll randomly get "hey did you know how to promote? Try it!" or "Do you still want to send this?" tutorial messages... when I cannot for the day anymore. Please disable these. I also don't need notifications every time someone likes an item telling me to make an offer, especially if I already made an offer that day. Too many notifications overall.

title: Move Over EBay
reviewText: I've been selling on eBay for some time now. I came across Mercari on a commercial and decided to give it a shot. I posted a few items and made a sale pretty quickly. As a seller, it's nice that Mercari only charges 10% so it's easy to know what you're making. eBay tries to control too many aspects of your post. I wish Mercari provided a Media Mail option so you have to create a label through PayPal. Posting seems to be easier and faster on Mercari. It has a nice and easy to use interface. I made a few purchases and the sellers are quick and reasonable too. I'm really glad I downloaded this app!

title: No Protection for Sellers
reviewText: I have used the Mercari app for a year and overall the functionality is good. My issue with the company is the lack of protection for Sellers. I shipped an item in decent condition and the Buyer requested a refund saying they did not like the item. The return process made no sense and I was never asked about the return from Support it was just initiated. In the middle of the return process the Buyer tried to sell the item but pulled the listing after I messaged asking the Buyer about the return. I messaged Mercari telling them what the Buyer was doing and told that the return would be intimated and I would get the item back. I received the item and it was damaged to the point that I would not be able to sell it again. I messaged the Buyer and they claimed it came like that, I asked why they tried to sell it if the it arrived like that and they backtracked asking for a partial refund. I took pictures and messaged Support with the photo evidence and cited the fact that the Buyer tried to resell the item when they received. I was denied my funds based on an vague review process. Now I have a damaged item that I will not be able to sell.

reviewText: Mercari is by far my favorite selling app. Things I list sell relatively fast and it's really simple, I can list things lying around my house in a few minutes. title: They get the $, not you
reviewText: Mercari used to be my go to selling platform for years! It was awesome. No fees, low shipping rates, quick sales. Now it seems that they block your items from being seen unless you post a lot of items at once, they take TEN PERCENT from your profits, shipping is a flop (it is whatever the price is through the shipping company NO deals), and now they have recently added TAXES. They're no better than any other selling platform. It's really a disappointment. By the time you sell an item you walk away with almost nothing. And when you buy an item you're paying more for it on this platform than you would via amazon, eBay, poshmark, etc.

title: Don’t use this app
reviewText: I will never use mercari ever again. First- there's not a ton of security and not a lot of help from mercari.Second- this place is littered with unresponsive buyers. So essentially, you could buy an item and never see it shipped. Yes you can go through the steps to get your money but it's a hassle that I shouldn't have to go through. What they should do is delete buyers who remain inactive over a certain period of time. Third, I've been harassed via messaging on this website and have reported this. Not a thing was done and their account is still up running and selling (this being someone who also let my offer expire bc they didn't respond) This app is a mess. Go somewhere else. They don't have it figured out like Poshmark or other platforms that are at least a bit better.

title: Terrible
reviewText: Mercari is a great platform for selling but they now will randomly suspend accounts. To get an account reinstated you have to submit a scan of your passport or drivers license. This seems like an insane amount of personal information to hand off to a company where you can't speak to a live customer service representative and when you email in questions, you get canned robo responses back. A complete invasion of privacy from a company that hire enough actual people to serve or assist it's users. Skip this and sell on Poshmark or EBay.

title: Violated My Legal Rights
reviewText: I used Mercari for a couple of years with no issues. For some reason, though, the postal service USPS has been sub par recently. They "lost" my package containing two items of $250 value. When I called USPS, they recalled the day I came in and said they just never scanned my package. I contacted Mercari. They told me they could do nothing, but did however call USPS and get the phone call where they told me they just threw my package aside. After I asked if that was legal, Mercari took action by saying they were closing my case for it to be never opened again. Then they refuse to let me message them. Now, the buyer and I cannot get the money or the product while Mercari does nothing. PS: USPS woman also pushed my package, pushed others packages off the desk, then forced me to pick them up. When I tried to call, they hung up on me after I waited over an hour to talk to someone. They said they remember the day but there was no reason that they were so rude to me. Anyway, Mercari does NOT stand behind its buyers or sellers. We both lost the money and product of $250 value. They violated my privacy and their own policies. I had sold over 200 items and never once got a bad review. I had over 200 reviews all 5 stars. Not a single one under 5 stars. I'm really upset they violated their own policies but legal rights as well. Use Poshmark.

title: Great app but needs some improvement!
reviewText: Competing applications with the same type of service offer ways to communicate with potential buyers letting them know which sales might be going on at certain times or what kind bundling/offers are accepted and welcomed. Mercari currently has no way to message people that have liked your item unless they message you first to notify them of sales and bundling options. Most buyers are unaware that offering or bundling is even available. If they were aware this would result in more sales for sellers which ultimately is more profit for Mercari as an app. I hope they consider adding a feature where you can message - not just send an offer, but message people that have liked your item.

title: AMAZING
reviewText: Okay to even begin this app is amazing. The fees are simple and easy. All you do is snap a photo, add title, description, shipping info, price and list. Once your item sells you ship it out (prepaid label of course), wait for it to be delivered then get paid. You can get the money direct deposited into your bank within a day, or use it as credits. Very easy to sell and buy, or just browse honestly. If you're looking to purchase ANYTHING check this app before you do because most likely 99.9% of the time they always have items for cheaper here.

title: Unresponsive seller, unresponsive app
reviewText: I paid $75 that I don't think I will get back for an item that was never sent. The one good thing I will say about them is you can see when the item is shipped and in transit. The bad thing is if the person doesn't send it and becomes unresponsive, they already have your money. After that, it is up to the buyer to "request cancellation" and since you cannot rate a transaction that was cancelled, you cannot rate the unresponsive person. Seems like a lot of unaccountable people with five stars selling things that might never make it to you.Been a month and still wondering if I'll ever see my $75 or not.

title: FRUSTRATED!
reviewText: UPDATE #2: I go through the trouble of resending the same package to the same person, only for them to return the item YET AGAIN. The buyer claimed damage so bad that it is not resell-able (it was checked and packed accordingly THE FIRST TIME IT WAS RETURNED). When I reached out to Mercari's horrible customer service, they claimed I packed the item incorrectly, and when I asked for proof other than hearsay, they simply stopped responding to me. Now I have a $300 itemthat is damaged, not resell-able and no reimbursement. Seriously people, don't waste your time. fully convinced they pay for good reviews bc every negative review seems to be the same complaint as mine. UPDATE: instead of assisting me with my sales issues, they stopped responding, cancelled my sales without consent and deleted my account. DUMBEST APP EVER. THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. shame on them for scamming people. Where do I begin? ZERO STARS. Not only are their policies vague and do not protect sellers when it comes to returns, but their customer support is SEVERELY lacking. Not only have I had to make multiple complaints when it comes to returns without any probable cause or reason, NOTHING is done about it. Getting in touch with a team member is frustrating in itself but when you finally do, its almost as if I am speaking to a robot with automatic responses. When returns are made, it seems that these claims are not properly and fairly investigated on both ends. any buyer can claim the purchase was "not as described" and the app will automatically approve the return even though I am NOT breaking any policy rules on my end.  Oh, and shipping is expensive. I think i'll stick to Poshmark, where I actually make money and all shipping is provided for. QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE. What a waste of time this has been for me. I have missed out on MUCH opportunity and sales with zero assistance.

title: Buyers Steer Ckear
reviewText: As a buyer steer clear and stick with ebay or other sites. I made my first purchase and an hour later I received an email that the seller cancelled my order because the item was on hold for someone else. It's ridiculous that this company would allow that, especially since they charge you immediately. Sure they're processing a refund but that policy is crazy. On top of that the cancelled transaction no longer shows up in my account and there is no way I can see to review the seller. So essentially they allow sellers to cancel orders and give buyers no way to leave feedback to let other potential buyers know of their negative experience. It also makes me think that if you purchased an expensive item or were in a tight spot financially at the holidays they've now locked up your funds for a week.  Overall not only will I not ever use this service again but I will post my experience everywhere possible and post a copy of the email I received somewhere else.

title: DONT TRUST THIS APP
reviewText: I bought a phone for 400$ and used a coupon on Mercari and in the end was 380$ the seller canceled it with in 10 mins because she put the item on hold for someone else. I got a msg and email saying I will get a refund in 10 days. If the transaction was canceled with in 24 hours it would be voided and no money would be taken out. I waited 10 days, still no refund. It said to wait a month. I was out of the country for a month and expected to see the 380$ back in my account. Still no refund. I call and call and call. Get put on hold for 45 mins, finally connects to be hung up on. I get to leave a voice mail after my 3rd time calling. They call me back saying they are sorry and can't do anything about it!!! Now I'm out 380$ for no reason. DONT TRUST THIS APP FOR REFUNDS.

title: Zero Buyer/Seller Protection and Glitchy App
reviewText: First off, I'm a very active user. Been on here fir over a year, have 300+ active listings and over 150 transactions completed as buyer and seller. I want to like this app, but they have some MAJOR drawbacks. All is well until you have a problem. Then Customer service is hard to reach, they seem to discourage you from contacting them, then they are notorious for disappearing mid email exchange. As a buyer, should something go wrong, they will try to refund you with credits not your hard earned money, if you even get that lucky. But the worst and most unbelievable part is that they don't reply to requests for help, or stop replying to you in the middle of an email exchange. Absolutely Unacceptable.. I purchased and item that was falsely represented, and the grief I had to go through to get a "store credit" was unreal. Then I had another purchase that never got shipped and they started sending me demanding emails that I rate the seller within 24 hours. When I had been recieved the item! This app needs some serious attention or they will go under. There's too much completion for selling apps at this point to waist your time and money here. Starting point for them should be to answer every and ALL help emails. If they can't do that, or employee people to, they should not be a viable business and take people's money. Period.

title: Another platform for fake sellers
reviewText: I was excited when I discover Mercari. It seems very straight forward the the fees are reasonable. However, they become a new platform for those selling fake shoes. I collect shoes for a living and I thought I'm getting hype shoes in discounted or below reseller price, I was wrong. All the penny spent on this up went all down to the drain. Their lack of better process when buyer tag a listed item fake is beyond unimaginable because they still allow the items listed. And when you request for a return because the item you received is fake, they give you the burden of making sure the actual item is faking by taking tons of photos and writing an essay like explanation on how do you know it's fake. Understably so but to hold you for days to get a response is a little big excessive. And to ask you to make more photos after you already present your case and proof is beyond me.I wish they have a better control and better process on making sure items being sell on their platform is authentic. If an item is flag as fake, they should take it down until the seller is able to prove otherwise. I'd tag tens of fake shoes but still listed. Again, I do this for a living and I've seen most of them. I specialized on Jordan 1 silhouette and I studied this specific type of shoes for years. Deconstruct shoes after shoes to study them and put them back again. I restored and authenticate pairs for other collectors. I've customized shoes to suit buyers or commissioned to do a custom. I have over 100 Jordan 1 colorways in my collection and I can smell fake miles away. Please have a better processed in screening fake items specially shoes.

title: Mercari-Good Competitor to Ebay or Amazon?
reviewText: If you want an alternative to Ebay or Amazon due to either not trusting or liking them (and lords know I've had my problems with them in the past), then I'd definitely recommend Mercari.It's mostly the same as the other two, but the prices are usually super cheap and you can even haggle to make them smaller if the seller accepts your offer. Not only that, but you have a much easier and more efficient way of communication with the seller due to it being part of the app. And the shipping is relatively quick as well.The best part is that the seller doesn't get paid until you after receiving your product and rating it, so you can easily obtain a refund if the product doesn't satisfy you or is in poor condition. The only downside is that things get sold super quick due to being on a first come, first serve basis. But it'd honestly be a nitpick at most, and this's easily still a great alternative to the other two online marketplaces.

title: Seller BEWARE!
reviewText: For the most part, the app is good, however, sellers will almost always get the short end of the stick in the event of disputes. I've had a buyer request USPS to hold her package at USPS for a MONTH without any communication and Mercari basically responded saying their hands are tied and I can try reaching out to the buyer, which, needless to say, I did without Mercari's advising. Then recently I had a buyer rate me poor, even though I had been nothing, but accommodating to her. She sent me a lower offer than my asking price, however, I accepted it and shipped same day and communicated, even though she never responded. Her poor rating of me was accompanied my the comment "fast". Yes, she rated me poorly due to providing fast service, which is highly unfair. I reached out to her, but to no avail. So I went to the help center and reached out to Mercari, but they simply told me that they can't do anything about it, even though it's unfair, unless I have the buyer reach out to them to change it- in order words, they wanted the buyer who purposely rated me poor for no legitimate reason to do the right thing or else they can't do anything about it. Let me add that I am a very seasoned seller and my ratings are all great, with the exception of that one. Overall, my experience is the app is good, unless there is a need to reach out to Mercari for any sort of help, then they are truly useless. They always act like everything is out of their hands and they have no control over anything that occurs on their own platform. Ridiculous. Sellers are at a disadvantage and we are on our own on this app. Mercari will take 10% of every sale, but don't expect them to aid us, sellers, in any way shape or form.

title: Terrible Customer Service
reviewText: Have you ever heard of "The customer is always right." Well with this company its the total opposite. I ordered an item which was inadequately described, and I was forced to send it to the company for a whopping $70 Shipping fee across the country to California, whats even worse is the seller lives is from the state above me! title: Ehh, it’s ok. Not bad...
reviewText: Mercari is a nice selling and buying app, HOWEVER as a seller I really wish it was much simpler and quicker to post your items for sale rather than go through all the descriptive steps it requires before you can post anything! It literally takes hours just to post up to ten items and it drains my battery!!!  Hardly worth the hassle unless you have a lot to get rid of and are trying to earn some extra cash. Let a few pictures and a brief description be enough as people can see what color, brand , & condition the items are in through all those pictures which tell you all that info about the item without having to type it all up in multiple description areas!!! Also why do you have to continually post items often for your listings page to stay fresh and seen by lots of people rather than get lost in the shuffle if you don't post frequently??  Can't there be a better way of keeping our listings refreshed and continually rotating back to the top so to speak??  And all those fees, WHEW!!! (sellers fees) and extra charges (prepaid shipping labels fees, etc...) Not sure how long I'll be using this app, might be looking for a cheaper, better, more user friendly selling app... but on the plus side of things I'm finally selling some of my stuff!! So we'll see how things go...

title: Great selling platform but watch your shipping!
reviewText: Love the ease of listing. Way better than ebay. Only issue i have is the shipping label. The first weight category listed for usps label is first class <1lb, like $5 or so on mercari. When the label prints and you're ready to ship, the label reads "15.9 lb, first class". When in  REALITY usps first class only goes up to 13 oz for that first "under 1lb" category. This is a flaw on mercari ‘s end. Usps $5 first class goes to 13oz only. So when that $5 label prints and reads that "15.9oz" it throws off the usps worker. Sometimes it gets overlooked by usps and sometimes it doesn't. If your item is even close to going over 13oz, you may want to be ready to pay more shipping coverage bc usps could technically make buyer pay more before they can receive their package. IT HAS HAPPENED before. So until this is corrected be careful of how much your items really weigh. I would give 5 stars but this shipping issue is enough to cause bad reviews for either party and it affects ratings. Other than that, I've had great success with selling and buying. The feature that lets you calculate your profit before listing is great!

title: Love so many things
reviewText: Mercari is a great place to sell your new, gently used and hand made items. Their customer service is impeccable. They are always swift to resolve any issues, weather as a buyer or a seller, that you may have, like getting ratings so you can get paid, or returning items that didn't arrive as described. I feel like they always have my back. It's nice to know the sellers don't get paid until you rate them, so if there's a problem you can return the item and get your $ back without any hassle. On top of all that if you're a seller, they take less commission than the other apps for selling and buying that are similar. I'd like to also mention you can sell and buy so many different thing, not just clothes, shoes and fashion type items, you can also find kitchen, camping, fishing, electronics, toys, collectibles, things for your car, things to clean with, bath and shower items, there are so many things you can buy and sell on there, the list could go on forever. The only things I'd change would be the shipping, it can be a little high for small items. The lowest shipping is 4.25 which is kind oh high for say a pair of earrings or a lipstick that normally cost a dollar or 2 to ship. As a seller I noticed they started making my listings, that have been on there for awhile inactive, that's frustrating as well, also sometimes I have to go in and change all my shipping options back to, buyer pays. But other than those small things, this is by far, in my opinion, a fantastic app to sell, or find items to buy at a discount. I've been using this app since it was in its beta test period and hopefully for many more years to come.

title: Too Annoying When Managing Listings
reviewText: I really want to give this app 5 stars, but I just can't due to how annoying it is when I try to manage my listings. I predominantly sell on Poshmark, but I have learned that there are some items that sell much better on Mercari. I also like the commission rate better on Mercari and the fact that you can get less expensive first class postage for small items. It is also nice to be able to advertise items with free shipping. However, when I finish making a change to a listing, or marking it as "promoted" and it jumps me back to the top of my list (or some other random place near the top) instead of allowing me to continue where I was, it is just plain annoying and makes me close the app in frustration. It is not user-friendly for people with a larger number of listings (I currently have 189). It is also a pain that I can't filter my listings to find a certain type of item quickly and have to scroll through.So, basically, if these little listing management flaws were fixed I would spend a lot more time on the app, change my rating to 5 stars, and list a bunch more items!

title: Mercari Allowed buyer to return my belt after the buyer damaged it.
reviewText: I got this app on recommendation from my sister. I just sold a brand new Tory Burch belt using the Mercari App. One day after it was delivered to the buyer Mercari notified me that the buyer wanted to return it and they granted the return. I tried to find out why she was returning it and they would not tell me. When I receive my belt back it was stretched out, warped and broken. The belt was straw and leather. The white elastic under the straw part of the belt was broken and the straw was warped. Appeared to be from someone trying it on or wearing it and the belt was too small for them. I have pictures of the new condition I sent the belt to the buyer and the damaged condition I received it back. The buyer got the belt in new condition tried it on or wore it took pictures of it after she broke it and told Mercari that it arrived that way. Mercari granted the return. I also have pictures of the box that was undamaged. The buyer shipped the belt back in the same box I sent it in. There is no damage to the box. I have no money for the belt and the belt is broken from the buyer and I can't resell it or even wear it. I have filed a complaint with the BBB. Do yourself a favor and read the reviews on BBB prior to using this app. They have 1.5 stars on the review section.

title: TRANSFERRING FUNDS IS A NIGHTMARE. BEWARE
reviewText: I bought the app of course wanting to sell unwanted items, you quickly get credit as people jump to try and get an item ASAP when you post it. Have a considerable amount of funds I want to transfer. I have provided my correct bank account information, the exact same info I use for work, THREE times, each time being told that my information was incorrect and was charged a non-refundable processing fee. I'm not surprised, I know that a company is going to be clingy and try to make the process of ACTUALLY getting cash as complicated as possible, but there is extremely minimal customer service. It's obvious from the layout they don't really want you to get funds and instead want you to apply it to buying other stuff. There's no reason that my information shouldn't be processed. It's the exact same as my bank information, checked again and again. I just want my money.

title: Sellers Get Screwed
reviewText: I'd rather pay 20% fees on other apps and get red carpet service.  The 10% fees are starting to not impress me.  Mercari now lets buyers return items if they've been breathed on the wrong way and you as a seller have no say nor do you get to know why they are returning the item.  Furthermore, I've had items returned to me in different condition then they've been sent and Mercari gives canned responses on why they don't give a crap.  My new return is epic!  The buyer is stating she didn't have enough time to decide on keeping the item, so Mercari customer support TOLD her to file a return to "give herself some more time to decide on whether or not she wants to keep the item." Then, she's admitting in the chat that she washed item and Mercari is still not doing anything about it.  It's really unbelievable how bad they treat sellers!

title: Disappointed in the app
reviewText: I signed up for this app, and was able to purchase an item quickly. However, they cancelled my order and suspended my account without telling me why. After trying to contact them for hours on end, I finally received an email saying that I was missing some information on my account. title: Hear me out, and please explain Mercari
reviewText: I downloaded this app about a week ago and its seemed amazing and all the deals were great and I was very happy with the way everything was laid out and how I was buying directly from people, BUT I've encountered issues that confuse me very much. #1 I was trying to buy an item and the buyer said "just kidding" and cancelled the order, why is that allowed? (I received my money back) #2 I was attempting to buy another item and I paid for it, and the seller shipped the item but out of nowhere Mercari THEMSELVES cancelled the order and refunded the money *no reason was given* and then I got another notification that my, and I quote, "account was cancelled" for some reason about the app not serving "US Territories" WHAT. #3 I sold an item to someone in Florida and the item went through and everything was fine but now that my account has been "cancelled" HOW AM I GOING TO GET MY PAYMENT!?!?!? This whole situation seems off and annoying because very little explanation is given for any action taken. #4 There is no way to directly contact anyone at Mercari. Any time you go to the ‘Help' section they only give you FAQ instead of something helpful!! I need to know what is going on with my account and how I am going to get my payment and why I can't use the app anymore. Everything just seems sketchy and need a response for why this is going on. I would greatly appreciate an explanation from Mercari.

title: SELLERS BEWARE
reviewText: I sold both a Fendi and Dior bag to a buyer in NY. I told her that I shipped both in the same package and to go by the tracking number for the Fendi bag. She was fine with it. Today she rated me 5 stars for the Fendi and lied about not receiving the Dior bag. Mercari cancelled it, and now she has my Dior bag AND $100 I was supposed to get for it! I went back and forth with Mercari and all they have said is that there's nothing they can do. No help whatsoever and absolutely no compensation. I'm beyond angry. This company is full of scammers. Refer to BBB, something I wish I did before downloading this app!
